item.title: Altcoins Lead $1B Crypto Crash Amid Escalating Middle East Tensions
item.description: Rising Middle East tensions have triggered a brutal selloff across the crypto market. Following Israel’s airstrike on Iran, over $1.15 billion in long positions were liquidated. Investors rushed to safe-haven assets, while risk-on markets collapsed. Altcoins faced the steepest losses. Ethereum dropped 7.8% to $2,533. Solana plunged 8.4% to $145,

item.title: Shiba Inu Dev Confirms TokenPlayAI Partnership as Start of Broader AI Integration Strategy
item.description: Shiba Inu lead Shytoshi Kusama has publicly endorsed the ecosystem’s partnership with AI gaming platform TokenPlayAI, describing the June 12 announcement as “big news” that marks the beginning of something special for the community. His reaction confirms earlier speculation about AI integration following recent updates to his social media biography,

item.title: The Evolution of Decentralized Exchanges (DEXs): What’s New for 2025?
item.description: Decentralised exchanges, also called DEXs, are blockchain platforms in which users trade cryptocurrencies with each other. They operate without intermediaries or central authorities, unlike centralised exchanges (CEXs) like Binance or Coinbase.  DEXs were created to autonomously match and execute trades using smart contracts, so users retain control of their assets

item.title: Cardano’s Hoskinson Defends $100M ADA-to-USDM Treasury Conversion Against Market Concerns
item.description: Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson has responded to community criticism regarding his proposal to convert 140 million ADA tokens from the ecosystem’s treasury into USDM stablecoin, defending the plan’s feasibility through over-the-counter trades and time-weighted average price mechanisms. The controversial proposal aims to address stablecoin liquidity shortages within Cardano’s DeFi ecosystem

item.description: VeChain has surrendered recent gains with a 5% intraday decline following its failure to break above the 50-day exponential moving average, creating renewed bearish pressure that threatens to undermine the token’s weekly recovery. item.title: Google’s “Gemini” AI Tool Predicts the Price of XRP, Pepe and Trump Coin by the End of 2025
item.description:
Gemini predicts the crypto rally has entered a durable phase likely to extend through late 2025. Using technical, macro and policy data, its models keep Bitcoin near records and chart potential multi-fold gains for Ripple’s XRP, meme leader PEPE and politically themed TRUMP.

item.title: Charles Hoskinson Eyes $100M Treasury Shift – Will Stablecoins Rescue Cardano’s TVL?
item.description:
Charles Hoskinson has detailed a proposal to convert $100M of ADA from the Cardano treasury into stablecoins and Bitcoin, saying added liquidity could draw broader DeFi use. He has proposed a sovereign-style fund with an elected board and regulated asset-manager partnerships.

item.title: Missed $PEPE or $WIF? Snorter Helps You Win the Meme Coin Game – ICO Hits $900K

item.description:

item.title: Donald Trump Pledges ‘Clear, Simple’ Onchain Rules Before Imminent GENIUS Act Vote
item.description:
Donald Trump has vowed to make America the “crypto capital,” criticizing Biden’s approach and listing measures such as ending Operation Chokepoint 2.0, creating a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve and backing the GENIUS Act, which faces a Senate vote on June 17 amid questions over his stablecoin links.

The post Donald Trump Pledges ‘Clear, Simple’ Onchain Rules Before Imminent GENIUS Act Vote appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: There Is No ‘Easy Road’ For Regulation Despite CFTC’s Pro-Growth Stance, Commissioner Caroline Pham Says
item.description:
Caroline Pham has clarified that the CFTC’s support for innovation does not weaken enforcement, warning crypto firms that fraud and theft will face prosecution. Her comments have come as four commissioners prepare to leave and Brian Quintenz awaits confirmation under the Trump administration.

The post There Is No ‘Easy Road’ For Regulation Despite CFTC’s Pro-Growth Stance, Commissioner Caroline Pham Says appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Gotbit Collapse: $23M Wash-Trading Scheme Nets CEO Prison, SEC Civil Suit Imminent
item.description:
Gotbit founder Aleksei Andriunin has received an eight-month U.S. sentence after pleading guilty to wire fraud and wash-trading market manipulation. The court has put the firm on five years’ probation, ordered it to close, and seized about $23 million in crypto.

The post Gotbit Collapse: $23M Wash-Trading Scheme Nets CEO Prison, SEC Civil Suit Imminent appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Weekly Crypto Regulation News Roundup: U.S. Inches Toward Clarity, Congress Advances Bills, and Senators Target Stablecoins
item.description:
Crypto regulation in the United States has advanced: lawmakers have folded the Blockchain Regulatory Certainty Act into wider legislation, the SEC has signaled interest in an innovation exemption, while new scrutiny targets stablecoins, Ripple, and Connecticut's fresh investment ban.

The post Weekly Crypto Regulation News Roundup: U.S. Inches Toward Clarity, Congress Advances Bills, and Senators Target Stablecoins appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Ethereum Dips 9%, Yet BlackRock Bets $570M: $4K Rally Ahead?
item.description:
Ethereum has shed 9% in a swift sell-off that erased $298M from 80,000 traders, but rising open interest to $35.22B and sustained BlackRock accumulation have mirrored new longs, suggesting confidence as price retests the $2,500 support that has contained volatility since early 2025.

The post Ethereum Dips 9%, Yet BlackRock Bets $570M: $4K Rally Ahead? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Coinbase Eyes $330B Corporate Bitcoin Wave; Warns of Imminent Systemic Shock
item.description:
Coinbase has issued an optimistic forecast for crypto in H2 2025, projecting new Bitcoin highs. It links growing corporate allocations, aided by fresh accounting rules, to price gains, yet flags systemic threats from debt-funded treasuries and potential forced selling.
